column4: can someone please tell me how to keep /etc/resolv.conf from changing?
it's set whenever your network connection gets new DNS servers
I had that problem earlier this year, you either have to fix your router to stop being a DNS server, or hack it to correct the resolve.conf on startup

this router serves 2 other windows machines so I don't want to change it, instead I'd like to change my machine alone, meaning configuring whatever program it is that changes resolv.conf to stop changing it.
